channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATAMONGO-1133] Field aliasing is not honored in Aggregation operations
item.description: the aggretation uses the property name of a class rather than the name designated in @Field.
item.summary: Field aliasing is not honored in Aggregation operations

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Do you have more details for this? Which aggregation operations are you using?

In Entity Meter:

@Field("counter_name")
 
private String countername;

where it's used:

TypedAggregation<Meter> aggregation =new TypedAggregation<Meter>(Meter.class,
 
group("countername").sum("countervolume").as("totalValue"),
 
match(where("resource_id").in(serverIds)));
 
AggregationResults<SummaryResult> results=mongoTemplate.aggregate(aggregation,SummaryResult.class);

@Field seems to be ignored.

if written like this:

TypedAggregation<Meter> aggregation =new TypedAggregation<Meter>(Meter.class,
 
  group("counter_name").sum("counter_volume").as("totalValue"),
 
  match(where("resource_id").in(serverIds)));
 
AggregationResults<SummaryResult> results=mongoTemplate.aggregate(aggregation,SummaryResult.class);

there's an error saying "No property counter found on Meter".
That's helpful, thanks. We're gonna look into it.

Thanks for reporting this.

Your first variant should actually work. Is the property aliased with resource_id marked with @Id and @Field?
In that case the rendered field would result in "_id" since @Id beats @Field aliases...

Just verified that you can do the following:

/**
 
 * @see DATAMONGO-1133
 
 */
 
@Test
 
public void shouldHonorFieldAliasesForFieldReferences() {
 
 
 
	mongoTemplate.insert(new MeterData("m1", "counter1", 42));
 
	mongoTemplate.insert(new MeterData("m1", "counter1", 13));
 
	mongoTemplate.insert(new MeterData("m1", "counter1", 45));
 
 
 
	TypedAggregation<MeterData> agg = newAggregation(MeterData.class, //
 
			match(where("resourceId").is("m1")), //
 
			group("counterName").sum("counterVolume").as("totalValue") //
 
	);
 
 
 
	AggregationResults<DBObject> results = mongoTemplate.aggregate(agg, DBObject.class);
 
 
 
	assertThat(results.getMappedResults(), hasSize(1));
 
	DBObject result = results.getMappedResults().get(0);
 
 
 
	assertThat(result.get("_id"), is(equalTo((Object) "counter1")));
 
	assertThat(result.get("totalValue"), is(equalTo((Object) 100.0)));
 
}

With MeterData as:

public class MeterData {
 
 
 
	@Id String id;
 
	String resourceId;
 
	@Field("counter_name") String counterName;
 
	double counterVolume;
 
 
 
	public MeterData() {}
 
 
 
	public MeterData(String resourceId, String counterName, double counterVolume) {
 
 
 
		this.resourceId = resourceId;
 
		this.counterName = counterName;
 
		this.counterVolume = counterVolume;
 
	}
 
//...
 
}

Hope that helps,
Cheers Thomas
I've merged the test cases into master and 1.6.x.

Looks like this has been forgotten for some reason. The merge to 1.6.x has not been applied which seems to have caused the 1.6.x builds to stay broken for quite some time. I just pushed the cherry pick into 1.6 and the build seems to be okay.

The fix seems to have made into 1.7 RC1 already. So I am additionally marking this as fixed for 1.6.3.
